$interpreted: Hanbei: I still can’t believe we're spending the night in the Slums.
Hutchinson: The cost of living in the Kingdom of the Sun is much higher than we expected. We don’t have much money, so we’ll just have to make due.
Ru-yi: I thought the Slums were much worse than this. It’s actually not that bad...
Ru-yi: Sophie, look! Someone’s giving out hot soup. I want some~
Sophie: You go ahead. I'm not hungry...
Sophie: (Both the headmaster and the queen won’t help...)
Sophie: (What if something happens to Elio or Rune...?)
Angelia: Have a taste. It’s best while it’s still hot!
Sophie: Thank you...
Angelia: Are you...crying?
Sophie: No, I-I-I was just...yawning.
Angelia: ...Can I sit with you?
Angelia: My wrists are getting sore from giving out all this soup anyway.
Sophie: Of course you can sit here...
Sophie: It’s really good...
Angelia: Whenever you’re feeling down, a bowl of hot soup~
Angelia: and a stranger who you can tell your worries to, is the perfect pair!
Sophie: A stranger to tell your worries to...?
Angelia: That’s right. We’ve met by fate, haven’t we? Who know if we’ll see each other again?
Angelia: I’ll probably forget everything tomorrow anyway~ There’s nothing to worry about.
Sophie: That’s true...
Angelia: Yup. Well, if you’re willing...I’m an outstanding listener!
Sophie: …………
Sophie: I’m so worried about Elio...if something happens to him, I ‘ll feel responsible for the rest of my life...
Angelia: Do you like him? The boy named Elio...
Sophie: I...actually, I basically was turned down already. Politely, of course.
Sophie: But now I just hope I can rescue him. As long as he is safe, that’s all I care about.
Angelia: He really is a lucky boy...
Angelia: Don’t be so disappointed. Perhaps tomorrow, things will start turning around.
Sophie: I really hope so...
Naya: Angel, I’ve already told you a million times; you’re the queen now...you can’t go running off to the Slums without saying anything.
Naya: Even though you’ve ordered this place to be rebuilt and it has already improved a lot, it still could be dangerous!
Angelia: Sorry for making you worry...
Angelia: Nobody here calls me queen...so it’s one of the few places I can relax.
Angelia: Don’t worry about that. Today I met a girl...she said she came from the Desert Kingdom.
Naya: The Desert Kingdom? Is she reliable?
Angelia: She didn’t look like a liar. Based on what she said...
Angelia: And add to that Commander Dylan’s report, it looks like the restlessness in the Desert Kingdom is about to erupt.
Naya: Angel, do you mean...
Angelia: Carry out the deployments I set up previously.
Angelia: Gather the forces and head towards the Desert Kingdom. That’s an order from the Queen of Kingdom of the Sun.
Naya: ...Understood!

Model.Text: I still can’t believe we're spending the night in the Slums.
The cost of living in the Kingdom of the Sun is much higher than we expected. We don’t have much money, so we’ll just have to make due.
I thought the Slums were much worse than this. It’s actually not that bad...
Sophie, look! Someone’s giving out hot soup. I want some~
You go ahead. I'm not hungry...
(Both the headmaster and the queen won’t help...)

Have a taste. It’s best while it’s still hot!
Thank you...
Are you...crying?
No, I-I-I was just...yawning.
...Can I sit with you?
My wrists are getting sore from giving out all this soup anyway.
Of course you can sit here...
It’s really good...
Whenever you’re feeling down, a bowl of hot soup~
and a stranger who you can tell your worries to, is the perfect pair!

That’s right. We’ve met by fate, haven’t we? Who know if we’ll see each other again?
I’ll probably forget everything tomorrow anyway~ There’s nothing to worry about.
That’s true...
Yup. Well, if you’re willing...I’m an outstanding listener!
I’m so worried about Elio...if something happens to him, I ‘ll feel responsible for the rest of my life...
Do you like him? The boy named Elio...
I...actually, I basically was turned down already. Politely, of course.
But now I just hope I can rescue him. As long as he is safe, that’s all I care about.
He really is a lucky boy...
Don’t be so disappointed. Perhaps tomorrow, things will start turning around.
I really hope so...
Angel, I’ve already told you a million times; you’re the queen now...you can’t go running off to the Slums without saying anything.
Even though you’ve ordered this place to be rebuilt and it has already improved a lot, it still could be dangerous!
Sorry for making you worry...
Nobody here calls me queen...so it’s one of the few places I can relax.
Don’t worry about that. Today I met a girl...she said she came from the Desert Kingdom.
The Desert Kingdom? Is she reliable?
She didn’t look like a liar. Based on what she said...
And add to that Commander Dylan’s report, it looks like the restlessness in the Desert Kingdom is about to erupt.
Angel, do you mean...
Carry out the deployments I set up previously.
Gather the forces and head towards the Desert Kingdom. That’s an order from the Queen of Kingdom of the Sun.
...Understood!
